CIRCUIT COURT OF
TALLAPOOSA COUNTY, ALABAMA
PATRICK CRADDOCK, CLERK
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF TALLAPOOSA COUNTY, ALABAMA
ALEXANDER CITY DIVISION
CHRISTOPHER BLAINE MCGREGOR,)
Plaintiff, )
)
v. ) CASE NO.: 70-DR-2023-900051.01
)
BRITTANY MICHELLE GILLILAND, )
Defendant. )
MOTION TO RECONSIDER
COMES NOW the Plaintiff, Christopher Blaine McGregor, by and through his attorney
of record, Tom F. Young, Jr., and respectfully asks this Court to reconsider its Order issued
November 6, 2024, and as grounds avers the following:
1. This Order will cause more of a divide with the relationship between the minor child, A.K.
and the mother, in particular the Wednesday evening dinners.
2. A.K. has extracurricular activities such as cheer practice, cheering at games, tumble
sessions on Wednesdays and A.K.’s schedule needs to be considered by the parties prior
to scheduling dinners and counseling.
WHEREFORE, PREMISES CONSIDERED, Plaintiff respectfully requests that the Court
reconsider its Order of November 6, 2024, and Order at least one (1) weekday dinner with all
parties.
/s/ Tom F. Young, Jr.
TOM F. YOUNG, JR. (YOU009)
Attorney for Plaintiff
OF COUNSEL:
Mr. Tom F. Young, Jr., Esq.
MORRIS HAYNES LLP
131 Main Street (35010)
Post Office Box 1660
Alexander City, Alabama 35011
Telephone: 256-329-2000
Facsimile: 256-329-2015
Email: tyoung@mhhlaw.net
